title: Strengths Discovery
description: Identify your natural character strengths — the qualities that feel effortless and energizing when you use them.

steps.title: You're Already Good at Something
steps.content: Think about the last time you were so absorbed in something that you lost track of time. That flow state wasn't random — you were using one of your core strengths. The tricky part is that strengths feel so natural to us that we often don't even notice them.

steps.title: Character Strengths: Your Built-In Superpowers
steps.content: Positive psychology research has identified 24 universal character strengths that all humans share in different combinations. Unlike skills you learn, character strengths are the natural capacities that energize you when you use them. You might be great at spreadsheets, but if it drains you, that's a skill — not a strength. True strengths meet three criteria: they feel authentic ("this is the real me"), they feel energizing (not depleting), and you learn quickly when you use them. Studies show that people who use their top strengths at work are six times more likely to be engaged and three times more likely to report an excellent quality of life.
steps.keyTakeaway: A real strength isn't just something you're good at — it's something that feels natural, energizes you, and makes you feel like the most authentic version of yourself.

steps.title: Spot Your Strengths
steps.content: Below is a simplified list of character strengths drawn from the VIA Classification. Check every strength that resonates with you — the ones where you think, "Yes, that's me." Don't overthink it. After you've checked all that apply, go back and star just your top 5.
steps.exercisePrompt: Check all the strengths that feel natural and energizing to you, then narrow to your top 5.

exerciseItems.label: Curiosity
exerciseItems.description: You love exploring new ideas, asking questions, and figuring things out

exerciseItems.label: Creativity
exerciseItems.description: You naturally find original ways to approach problems and express ideas

exerciseItems.label: Perseverance
exerciseItems.description: You push through obstacles and finish what you start

exerciseItems.label: Kindness

exerciseItems.label: Leadership
exerciseItems.description: You naturally organize groups and inspire people toward a goal

exerciseItems.label: Humor

exerciseItems.label: Fairness

exerciseItems.label: Love of Learning

exerciseItems.label: Bravery

exerciseItems.label: Gratitude

exerciseItems.label: Teamwork

exerciseItems.label: Social Intelligence

exerciseItems.label: Self-Regulation

steps.title: What Your Strengths Tell You
steps.content: Look at the strengths you selected. These aren't just personality traits — they're clues about the kind of work that will light you up.

reflectPrompts.prompt: Do you notice a pattern or theme among your top strengths? What might they have in common?
How often do you get to use your top strengths in your current work?
Describe a specific moment when you were using one of your top strengths and it felt amazing.

steps.title: Put a Strength to Work
steps.content: Research shows that intentionally using a top strength in a new way each day for just one week significantly boosts wellbeing. Let's start with today.
steps.commitPrompt: Choose one way to deliberately use a top strength today:
commitOptions: Use my #1 strength in a new or different way at work today
Ask a friend or colleague what they think my greatest strength is
Write down one way I could use my top strength more in my current role
